app.desc: REQUIRED WHEN RUNNING APP: command-line for executing your app or a cloud assembly directory (e.g. "node bin/my-app.js"). Can also be specified in cdk.json or ~/.cdk.json

plugin.desc: Name or path of a node package that extend the CDK features. Can be specified multiple times

strict.desc: Do not construct stacks with warnings

lookups.desc: Perform context lookups (synthesis fails if this is disabled and context lookups need to be performed)

ignore-errors.desc: Ignores synthesis errors, which will likely produce an invalid output

json.desc: Use JSON output instead of YAML when templates are printed to STDOUT

verbose.desc: Show debug logs (specify multiple times to increase verbosity)

debug.desc: Debug the CDK app. Log additional information during synthesis, such as creation stack traces of tokens (sets CDK_DEBUG, will slow down synthesis)

profile.desc: Use the indicated AWS profile as the default environment

proxy.desc: Use the indicated proxy. Will read from HTTPS_PROXY environment variable if not specified

ca-bundle-path.desc: Path to CA certificate to use when validating HTTPS requests. Will read from AWS_CA_BUNDLE environment variable if not specified

ec2creds.desc: Force trying to fetch EC2 instance credentials. Default: guess EC2 instance status

version-reporting.desc: Disable CLI telemetry and do not include the "AWS::CDK::Metadata" resource in synthesized templates (enabled by default)

path-metadata.desc: Include "aws:cdk:path" CloudFormation metadata for each resource (enabled by default)

asset-metadata.desc: Include "aws:asset:*" CloudFormation metadata for resources that uses assets (enabled by default)

role-arn.desc: ARN of Role to use when invoking CloudFormation

staging.desc: Copy assets to the output directory (use --no-staging to disable the copy of assets which allows local debugging via the SAM CLI to reference the original source files)

output.desc: Emits the synthesized cloud assembly into a directory (default: cdk.out)

no-color.desc: Removes colors and other style from console output

ci.desc: Force CI detection. If CI=true then logs will be sent to stdout instead of stderr

unstable.desc: Opt in to unstable features. The flag indicates that the scope and API of a feature might still change. Otherwise the feature is generally production ready and fully supported. Can be specified multiple times.

telemetry-file.desc: Send telemetry data to a local file.

yes.desc: Automatically answer interactive prompts with the recommended response. This includes confirming actions.

list.description: Lists all stacks in the app

long.desc: Display environment information for each stack

show-dependencies.desc: Display stack dependency information for each stack

synth.description: Synthesizes and prints the CloudFormation template for this stack

exclusively.desc: Only synthesize requested stacks, don't include dependencies

validation.desc: After synthesis, validate stacks with the "validateOnSynth" attribute set (can also be controlled with CDK_VALIDATION)

quiet.desc: Do not output CloudFormation Template to stdout

bootstrap.description: Deploys the CDK toolkit stack into an AWS environment

bootstrap-bucket-name.desc: The name of the CDK toolkit bucket; bucket will be created and must not exist

bootstrap-kms-key-id.desc: AWS KMS master key ID used for the SSE-KMS encryption (specify AWS_MANAGED_KEY to use an AWS-managed key)

custom-permissions-boundary.desc: Use the permissions boundary specified by name.

bootstrap-customer-key.desc: Create a Customer Master Key (CMK) for the bootstrap bucket (you will be charged but can customize permissions, modern bootstrapping only)

qualifier.desc: String which must be unique for each bootstrap stack. You must configure it on your CDK app if you change this from the default.

public-access-block-configuration.desc: Block public access configuration on CDK toolkit bucket (enabled by default)

deny-external-id.desc: Block AssumeRole access to all boostrapped roles if an ExternalId is provided (enabled by default)

tags.desc: Tags to add for the stack (KEY=VALUE)

execute.desc: Whether to execute ChangeSet (--no-execute will NOT execute the ChangeSet)

trust.desc: The AWS account IDs that should be trusted to perform deployments into this environment (may be repeated, modern bootstrapping only)

trust-for-lookup.desc: The AWS account IDs that should be trusted to look up values in this environment (may be repeated, modern bootstrapping only)

untrust.desc: The AWS account IDs that should not be trusted by this environment (may be repeated, modern bootstrapping only)

cloudformation-execution-policies.desc: The Managed Policy ARNs that should be attached to the role performing deployments into this environment (may be repeated, modern bootstrapping only)

force.desc: Always bootstrap even if it would downgrade template version

termination-protection.desc: Toggle CloudFormation termination protection on the bootstrap stacks

show-template.desc: Instead of actual bootstrapping, print the current CLI's bootstrapping template to stdout for customization

toolkit-stack-name.desc: The name of the CDK toolkit stack to create

template.desc: Use the template from the given file instead of the built-in one (use --show-template to obtain an example)

previous-parameters.desc: Use previous values for existing parameters (you must specify all parameters on every deployment if this is disabled)

gc.description: Garbage collect assets. Options detailed here: https://github.com/aws/aws-cdk-cli/tree/main/packages/aws-cdk#cdk-gc

action.desc: The action (or sub-action) you want to perform. Valid entires are "print", "tag", "delete-tagged", "full".

type.desc: Specify either ecr, s3, or all

rollback-buffer-days.desc: Delete assets that have been marked as isolated for this many days

created-buffer-days.desc: Never delete assets younger than this (in days)

confirm.desc: Confirm via manual prompt before deletion

toolkit-stack-name.desc: The name of the CDK toolkit stack, if different from the default "CDKToolkit"

bootstrap-stack-name.desc: The name of the CDK toolkit stack, if different from the default "CDKToolkit" (deprecated, use --toolkit-stack-name)

value.desc: The value the user would like to set the feature flag configuration to

set.desc: Signifies the user would like to modify their feature flag configuration

all.desc: Modify or view all feature flags

interactive.desc: Interactive option for the flags command

safe.desc: Enable all feature flags that do not impact the user's application

concurrency.desc: Maximum number of simultaneous synths to execute.

deploy.description: Deploys the stack(s) named STACKS into your AWS account

build-exclude.desc: Do not rebuild asset with the given ID. Can be specified multiple times

exclusively.desc: Only deploy requested stacks, don't include dependencies

require-approval.desc: What security-sensitive changes need manual approval

notification-arns.desc: ARNs of SNS topics that CloudFormation will notify with stack related events. These will be added to ARNs specified with the 'notificationArns' stack property.

tags.desc: Tags to add to the stack (KEY=VALUE), overrides tags from Cloud Assembly (deprecated)

execute.desc: Whether to execute ChangeSet (--no-execute will NOT execute the ChangeSet) (deprecated)

change-set-name.desc: Name of the CloudFormation change set to create (only if method is not direct)

method.desc: How to perform the deployment. Direct is a bit faster but lacks progress information

import-existing-resources.desc: Indicates if the stack set imports resources that already exist.

force.desc: Always deploy stack even if templates are identical

parameters.desc: Additional parameters passed to CloudFormation at deploy time (STACK:KEY=VALUE)

outputs-file.desc: Path to file where stack outputs will be written as JSON

previous-parameters.desc: Use previous values for existing parameters (you must specify all parameters on every deployment if this is disabled)

toolkit-stack-name.desc: The name of the existing CDK toolkit stack (only used for app using legacy synthesis)

progress.desc: Display mode for stack activity events

rollback.desc: Rollback stack to stable state on failure. Defaults to 'true', iterate more rapidly with --no-rollback or -R. Note: do **not** disable this flag for deployments with resource replacements, as that will always fail

hotswap.desc: Attempts to perform a 'hotswap' deployment, but does not fall back to a full deployment if that is not possible. Instead, changes to any non-hotswappable properties are ignored.Do not use this in production environments

hotswap-fallback.desc: Attempts to perform a 'hotswap' deployment, which skips CloudFormation and updates the resources directly, and falls back to a full deployment if that is not possible. Do not use this in production environments

hotswap-ecs-minimum-healthy-percent.desc: Lower limit on the number of your service's tasks that must remain in the RUNNING state during a deployment, as a percentage of the desiredCount

hotswap-ecs-maximum-healthy-percent.desc: Upper limit on the number of your service's tasks that are allowed in the RUNNING or PENDING state during a deployment, as a percentage of the desiredCount

hotswap-ecs-stabilization-timeout-second.desc: Number of seconds to wait for a single service to reach stable state, where the desiredCount is equal to the runningCount

watch.desc: Continuously observe the project files, and deploy the given stack(s) automatically when changes are detected. Implies --hotswap by default

logs.desc: Show CloudWatch log events from all resources in the selected Stacks in the terminal. 'true' by default, use --no-logs to turn off. Only in effect if specified alongside the '--watch' option

concurrency.desc: Maximum number of simultaneous deployments (dependency permitting) to execute.

asset-parallelism.desc: Whether to build/publish assets in parallel

asset-prebuild.desc: Whether to build all assets before deploying the first stack (useful for failing Docker builds)

ignore-no-stacks.desc: Whether to deploy if the app contains no stacks

rollback.description: Rolls back the stack(s) named STACKS to their last stable state

toolkit-stack-name.desc: The name of the CDK toolkit stack the environment is bootstrapped with

force.desc: Orphan all resources for which the rollback operation fails.

validate-bootstrap-version.desc: Whether to validate the bootstrap stack version. Defaults to 'true', disable with --no-validate-bootstrap-version.

orphan.desc: Orphan the given resources, identified by their logical ID (can be specified multiple times)

import.description: Import existing resource(s) into the given STACK

execute.desc: Whether to execute ChangeSet (--no-execute will NOT execute the ChangeSet)

change-set-name.desc: Name of the CloudFormation change set to create

toolkit-stack-name.desc: The name of the CDK toolkit stack to create

rollback.desc: Rollback stack to stable state on failure. Defaults to 'true', iterate more rapidly with --no-rollback or -R. Note: do **not** disable this flag for deployments with resource replacements, as that will always fail

force.desc: Do not abort if the template diff includes updates or deletes. This is probably safe but we're not sure, let us know how it goes.

record-resource-mapping.desc: If specified, CDK will generate a mapping of existing physical resources to CDK resources to be imported as. The mapping will be written in the given file path. No actual import operation will be performed

resource-mapping.desc: If specified, CDK will use the given file to map physical resources to CDK resources for import, instead of interactively asking the user. Can be run from scripts

build-exclude.desc: Do not rebuild asset with the given ID. Can be specified multiple times

exclusively.desc: Only deploy requested stacks, don't include dependencies

change-set-name.desc: Name of the CloudFormation change set to create

force.desc: Always deploy stack even if templates are identical

toolkit-stack-name.desc: The name of the existing CDK toolkit stack (only used for app using legacy synthesis)

progress.desc: Display mode for stack activity events

rollback.desc: Rollback stack to stable state on failure. Defaults to 'true', iterate more rapidly with --no-rollback or -R. Note: do **not** disable this flag for deployments with resource replacements, as that will always fail

hotswap.desc: Attempts to perform a 'hotswap' deployment, but does not fall back to a full deployment if that is not possible. Instead, changes to any non-hotswappable properties are ignored.'true' by default, use --no-hotswap to turn off

hotswap-fallback.desc: Attempts to perform a 'hotswap' deployment, which skips CloudFormation and updates the resources directly, and falls back to a full deployment if that is not possible.

hotswap-ecs-minimum-healthy-percent.desc: Lower limit on the number of your service's tasks that must remain in the RUNNING state during a deployment, as a percentage of the desiredCount

hotswap-ecs-maximum-healthy-percent.desc: Upper limit on the number of your service's tasks that are allowed in the RUNNING or PENDING state during a deployment, as a percentage of the desiredCount

hotswap-ecs-stabilization-timeout-second.desc: Number of seconds to wait for a single service to reach stable state, where the desiredCount is equal to the runningCount

logs.desc: Show CloudWatch log events from all resources in the selected Stacks in the terminal. 'true' by default, use --no-logs to turn off

concurrency.desc: Maximum number of simultaneous deployments (dependency permitting) to execute.

exclusively.desc: Only destroy requested stacks, don't include dependees

force.desc: Do not ask for confirmation before destroying the stacks

diff.description: Compares the specified stack with the deployed stack or a local template file, and returns with status 1 if any difference is found

exclusively.desc: Only diff requested stacks, don't include dependencies

context-lines.desc: Number of context lines to include in arbitrary JSON diff rendering

template.desc: The path to the CloudFormation template to compare with

strict.desc: Do not filter out AWS::CDK::Metadata resources, mangled non-ASCII characters, or the CheckBootstrapVersionRule

security-only.desc: Only diff for broadened security changes

fail.desc: Fail with exit code 1 in case of diff

processed.desc: Whether to compare against the template with Transforms already processed

quiet.desc: Do not print stack name and default message when there is no diff to stdout

change-set.desc: Whether to create a changeset to analyze resource replacements. In this mode, diff will use the deploy role instead of the lookup role.

import-existing-resources.desc: Whether or not the change set imports resources that already exist

include-moves.desc: Whether to include moves in the diff

drift.description: Detect drifts in the given CloudFormation stack(s)

fail.desc: Fail with exit code 1 if drift is detected

metadata.description: Returns all metadata associated with this stack

acknowledge.description: Acknowledge a notice so that it does not show up anymore

notices.description: Returns a list of relevant notices

unacknowledged.desc: Returns a list of unacknowledged notices

init.description: Create a new, empty CDK project from a template.

language.desc: The language to be used for the new project (default can be configured in ~/.cdk.json)

generate-only.desc: If true, only generates project files, without executing additional operations such as setting up a git repo, installing dependencies or compiling the project

lib-version.desc: The version of the CDK library (aws-cdk-lib) to initialize built-in templates with. Defaults to the version that was current when this CLI was built.

from-path.desc: Path to a local custom template directory or multi-template repository

template-path.desc: Path to a specific template within a multi-template repository

migrate.description: Migrate existing AWS resources into a CDK app

stack-name.desc: The name assigned to the stack created in the new project. The name of the app will be based off this name as well.

language.desc: The language to be used for the new project

account.desc: The account to retrieve the CloudFormation stack template from

region.desc: The region to retrieve the CloudFormation stack template from

from-path.desc: The path to the CloudFormation template to migrate. Use this for locally stored templates

from-stack.desc: Use this flag to retrieve the template for an existing CloudFormation stack

output-path.desc: The output path for the migrated CDK app

from-scan.desc:
Determines if a new scan should be created, or the last successful existing scan should be used 
 options are "new" or "most-recent"

filter.desc:
Filters the resource scan based on the provided criteria in the following format: "key1=value1,key2=value2"
 This field can be passed multiple times for OR style filtering: 
 filtering options: 
 resource-identifier: A key-value pair that identifies the target resource. i.e. {"ClusterName", "myCluster"}
 resource-type-prefix: A string that represents a type-name prefix. i.e. "AWS::DynamoDB::"
 tag-key: a string that matches resources with at least one tag with the provided key. i.e. "myTagKey"
 tag-value: a string that matches resources with at least one tag with the provided value. i.e. "myTagValue"

compress.desc: Use this flag to zip the generated CDK app

reset.desc: The context key (or its index) to reset

docs.description: Opens the reference documentation in a browser

browser.desc: the command to use to open the browser, using %u as a placeholder for the path of the file to open

doctor.description: Check your set-up for potential problems

refactor.description: Moves resources between stacks or within the same stack

additional-stack-name.desc: Names of deployed stacks to be considered for resource comparison.

dry-run.desc: Do not perform any changes, just show what would be done

override-file.desc: A file that declares overrides to be applied to the list of mappings computed by the CLI.

revert.desc: If specified, the command will revert the refactor operation. This is only valid if a mapping file was provided.

force.desc: Whether to do the refactor without asking for confirmation
